verses.kjv: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.
verses.web: Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, not many of you should become teachers. You know that those of us who teach will be judged more strictly.

verses.kjv: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.
verses.web: For we all stumble in many things. Anyone who doesn’t stumble in word is a perfect person, able to bridle the whole body also.
verses.ct: We all stumble in many ways. But if someone never stumbles in what they say, that person has reached maturity and can keep their entire body in check.

verses.kjv: Behold, we put bits in the horses’ mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.
verses.web: Indeed, we put bits into the horses’ mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body.
verses.ct: Think about it: we put bits into the mouths of horses to make them obey us, and with that small piece of metal we steer their whole body.

verses.kjv: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.
verses.web: Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires.
verses.ct: Or consider ships — even massive ones driven by fierce winds are steered by a tiny rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.

verses.kjv: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!
verses.web: So the tongue is also a little member, and boasts great things. See how a small fire can spread to a large forest!
verses.ct: In the same way, the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes enormous claims. Think about how a tiny spark can set an entire forest ablaze!

verses.kjv: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.
verses.web: And the tongue is a fire. The world of iniquity among our members is the tongue, which defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by Gehenna.
verses.ct: The tongue is a fire — a whole world of evil right there among the parts of our body. It corrupts the entire person, sets the whole course of life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell.

verses.kjv: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:
verses.web: For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and sea creature, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind;
verses.ct: Every kind of animal, bird, reptile, and sea creature has been tamed by human beings — and continues to be tamed.

verses.kjv: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.
verses.web: but nobody can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.
verses.ct: But no one can tame the tongue. It's a restless evil, full of deadly poison.

verses.kjv: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.
verses.web: With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men who are made in the image of God.
verses.ct: With the tongue we praise God our Father, and with the same tongue we curse people who are made in the image of God.

verses.kjv: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.
verses.web: Out of the same mouth comes blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.
verses.ct: Praise and cursing pour out of the same mouth. Brothers and sisters, this should never be the case.

verses.kjv: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?
verses.web: Does a spring send out from the same opening fresh and bitter water?
verses.ct: Does a spring pour out fresh water and bitter water from the same opening?

verses.kjv: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.
verses.web: Can a fig tree, my brothers, yield olives, or a vine figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh water.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, can a fig tree produce olives? Can a grapevine produce figs? Of course not — and a saltwater spring can't produce fresh water either.

verses.kjv: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
verses.web: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good conduct that his deeds are done in gentleness of wisdom.
verses.ct: Is anyone among you wise and understanding? Then prove it by living a good life, letting your actions flow from the gentleness that comes with true wisdom.

verses.kjv: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.
verses.web: But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don’t boast and don’t lie against the truth.
verses.ct: But if your heart is full of bitter jealousy and selfish ambition, don't brag about it — that would be lying against the truth.

verses.kjv: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.
verses.web: This wisdom is not that which comes down from above, but is earthly, sensual, and demonic.
verses.ct: That kind of "wisdom" doesn't come down from heaven. It's earthly, driven by selfish desires, and demonic.

verses.kjv: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.
verses.web: For where jealousy and selfish ambition are, there is confusion and every evil deed.
verses.ct: Wherever jealousy and selfish ambition exist, you'll find disorder and every kind of evil.

verses.kjv: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
verses.web: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceful, gentle, reasonable, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
verses.ct: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure, then peaceful, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial, and sincere.

verses.kjv: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
verses.web: Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
verses.ct: Those who make peace plant seeds of righteousness and harvest a crop of peace.
